Fancy playing for LA Galaxy? MLS side to host UK trials to find next David Beckham and Steven Gerrard Hopeful players will be given the chance to impress in London and Manchester over May and June   Share   Comments By Jack Rathborn 08:49, 23 FEB 2017 Sport The LA Galaxy hope to find the next David Beckham, Steven Gerrard and Robbie Keane (Photo: Getty Images)   Share   Comments Get football   LA Galaxy are set to offer hopeful players the chance to earn a professional contract with open trials in the UK. 
The MLS franchise have announced plans to find the next David Beckham and Steven Gerrard. 
Trials will take place at The Hive in London and the University of Manchester Armitage Sports Centre in Manchester.
Hopeful prospects will need to be aged 16-25 and submit a payment of Â£149 ($185), with five talents selected from each venue to fly to the City of Angels for a more thorough trial.
David Beckham starred at the end of his career for the Galaxy (Photo: PA) Read More Should Wayne Rooney leave Manchester United for China? Our reporters have their say Academy Director Mike Munoz insists there are 'hidden gems' out there who went 'without a fair chance in the past.'
"Scouting for Galaxy II will give us a chance to evaluate numerous players, including first-time pros, or young pros who are not under contract," Munoz said.
Steven Gerrard followed David Beckham with an LA swan song (Photo: Getty Images) "We want to make sure everyone has a fair opportunity to be evaluated and earn a professional contract on our 2017 LA Galaxy II roster."
